intro: Lisianthius elegans var. simplex, commonly known as the elegant lisianthius, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, daisy-like blooms in shades of white and yellow. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and natural landscapes.
